name: Munich and National-Socialism
description:
Munich was the birthplace of one of the most dangerous
and destructive political movements of the 20th century, where a young and ambitious
Adolf Hitler began his career. The dictator would later refer to Munich as “the capital
of the movement” (Hauptstadt der Bewegung), making plans for rebuilding it in
his own image. Is there any trace of this fallen ideal left? If yes, what do
those traces mean to us today and what can we learn from their fall? In this program, we shall walk among the ruins of this past, revisiting one of the
darkest chapters of our history while discussing questions such as “why?” and “how?”.
